API Documentation¶

model.py¶

Implements the data model for the app.

All the entities derive from ndb class of Google App Engine.

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015
class model.Course(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent course information in the datastore.

Parent of the Section object.

is_active¶

Boolean. Indicates if the course is currently active or not.

name¶

String. Must be non-empty and unique.

class model.Group(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent the Group of students in a course section.

members¶

List of Strings. Emails of the Students in this group.

number¶

Integer. Index of the group within that Section

size¶

Integer. Size of this group.

class model.Instructor(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent the course Instrutor in the app.

email¶

String. Must be non-empty and unique. Retrieved from Gmail automatically

is_active¶

Boolean. Indicates if this instructor is active or not.

class model.Question(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent the Question in the data store. Currently only multiple choice questions are supported.

options¶

List of Strings. Options for this question.

options_total¶

Integer. Number of options for the question.

question¶

String. The text of the question.

class model.Response(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent all types of student responses.

comment¶

String. Comment no a peer’s post from the previous round.

option¶

String. Selected option from the multiple choices, if it’s a response to a quiz round.

response¶

List of Strings. Can take values support, disagree or neutral.

student¶

String. Email of the Student who is the author of this response.

summary¶

String. The summary post in the last round.

class model.Round(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent the Round in the datastore.

deadline¶

String. Represents the deadline in the format %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M

description¶

String. Description or brief instructions for the round.

is_quiz¶

Boolean. If True, this is a quiz round (e.g., lead-in question); if False, a discussion round.

number¶

Integer. Index of the round.

quiz¶

A Question property. Contains the question if this is a quiz round.

class model.Section(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent section information in the datastrore.

Child of the Course object.

current_round¶

Integer. Index of the current round. (default: 0)

groups¶

Integer. Number of groups in this section. (default: 0)

is_active¶

Boolean. Indicates if this section is active or not.

name¶

String. Must be non-empty and unique within a course.

rounds¶

Integer. Number of rounds for this section. (default: 0)

students¶

List of StudentInfo representing all the Student entities in this section.

class model.Student(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent the Student in the app.

email¶

String. Must be non-empty and unique. Retrieved from Gmail automatically

sections¶

List of active Section s this student is enrolled in.

class model.StudentInfo(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

An object to represent a student’s information in the datastore.

alias¶

String. Identifies a student within a discussion round. Takes values S1, S2, etc.

email¶

String. Must be non-empty and unique.

group¶

Integer. The group this student is part of.

consider.py¶

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015

Main module of the app. Implements the application object; handlers for error, home and root pages; and redirects URL to appropriate handler classes.

class consider.ErrorPage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

Handles the /error page, a generic page to display errors based on app-specific, custom error code.

The error codes are:

  • ‘100’: “Oops! Something went wrong please try again.”,
  • ‘101’: “Sorry you are not registered with this application, please contact your Instructor.”,
  • ‘102’: “Sorry you are not an instructor.”,
  • ‘103’: “Sorry no rounds are active for this section, please try again later.”,
  • ‘104’: “Sorry the round was not found, please contact your Instructor.”,
  • ‘105’: “Sorry, your group was not found, please contact your Instructor.”

HTTP errors like 404, 500 are handled by the system in the default manner.

get()[source]¶

If a valid user is logged in, loads the template error.html and displays the appropriate error message, corresponding to the error code sent in, on it. Redirects to the root page (/) otherwise.

class consider.HomePage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

Handles the /home page. Redirects based on the role of the user (Instructor or Student).

get()[source]¶

If a valid user is logged in, and if the user is an Instructor, redirect to the Instructor console, which contains a list of courses and sections that instructor is in charge of; if the user is a Student, retrieves the list of sections that student is enrolled in, and redirects to the student home page populated with that list.

class consider.MainPage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

Handles the main landing page (/) of the app.

If the user is authenticated successfully, redirects to the /home page, otherwise to the login page.

get()[source]¶

The HTTP GET method on the MainPage.

Renders or redirects appropriately.

admin.py¶

APIs for handling admin specific tasks of the app, like adding an instructor.

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015
class admin.AdminPage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API for the main page (/admin) for the admin/developer.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the list of instructors currently added to the app.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to add an instructor.

class admin.AdminToggleInstructor(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to activate or deactivate an instructor.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to toggle the instructor’s status.

instructor.py¶

Implements the APIs for Instructor role in the app.

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015
class instructor.ActivateRound(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to activate a particular round for this section.

The instructor can add rounds in advance, but has to activate each round when it is supposed to start.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to activate the round.

class instructor.AddCourse(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

Adds a new course with the given name to the database.

Course names must be unique. If the user tries to add a course with a previously used name again, it flags a message.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to add the course.

class instructor.AddGroups(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to organize students in to groups.

The user (instructor) can modify the number of groups and then assign each student to one of the groups.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to create groups.

class instructor.AddRound(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to add a round to the section.

Pops open a new modal which asks for the details of the round, including deadline and question.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to add the round.

class instructor.AddSection(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

Adds a new section to the given course.

Section names must be unique within a course. If a user tries to add a section with a previously used name, it flags a message.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to add a section to a course.

class instructor.AddStudent(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to add a student to the given section and course.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to add the student.

class instructor.GroupResponses(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to retrieve and display responses for each section, organized into groups.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the group responses.

class instructor.Groups(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to retrieve and display the information of groups formed for the selected course and section.

class instructor.RemoveStudent(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to remove a student from a section of the course.

The student still continues to be part of other sections of this course and other courses in the app.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to remove the student.

class instructor.Responses(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to retrieve and display responses for each section, tabbed into different rounds.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the responses.

class instructor.Rounds(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to retrieve and display the information of rounds for the selected course and section.

By default, the alphabetically first course and first section is selected. To look at the rounds for other course/sections, the user can select from the given drop down list.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the rounds.

class instructor.StudentsPage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to display the list of students in the selected section.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the students.

class instructor.ToggleCourse(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to toggle between active and inactive course status. An instructor can call this API.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to toggle the course status.

class instructor.ToggleSection(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to toggle between active and inactive section status. An instructor can call this API.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to toggle the section status.

class instructor.UpdateGroups(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to update the group assignments.

The user (instructor) can reassign groups using this API.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to update the groups.

student.py¶

Implements the APIs for Student role in the app.

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015
class student.Discussion(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to retrieve discussion information, i.e. the responses from previous round and deadline for the current round.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the discussion information.

class student.SectionPage(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to redirect a student based on what stage she is in in a particular section: lead-in question, discussion or summary round.

If no round is active for this section, it redirects to an appropriate error page.

get()[source]¶

HTTP GET method to retrieve the sections and rounds under it.

class student.SubmitResponse(request=None, response=None)[source]¶

API to submit a student’s response to the current round.

The student can save the response and return again, before the deadline, to modify it.

post()[source]¶

HTTP POST method to submit the response.

utils.py¶

Defines the functions and constants which are accessed by different modules of this application.

  • Author(s): Rohit Kapoor, Swaroop Joshi
  • Last Modified: Dec. 18, 2015
utils.get_courses_and_sections(instructor, course_name, selected_section)[source]¶

Fetches the courses and sections for the given instructor.

Args:
instructor (object): Instructor whose courses are to be retrieved course_name (str): Name of the course whose sections are to be retrieved (optional) selected_section (str): Name of the selected section (optional)
Returns:
template_values (dict): Courses and sections to be rendered.
utils.get_role(user)[source]¶

Checks and returns if the user is an Instructor or a Student, False if neither.

Args:
user: The user whose role is to be retrieved.
Returns:
object: Instructor or Student or False.
utils.is_valid_response(response)[source]¶

Checks if any of the responses is one of the three valid options: support, neutral or disagree.

Args:
response (list): A list of responses to be checked.
Returns:
bool: True if all of the responses are valid. False if any is invalid.
